title: 'Now you owe her an apology!': Jeremy McConnell shares picture of Stephanie Davis' son claiming he IS the dad
text:

Fans of Stephanie Davis have demanded "deadbeat dad" Jeremy McConnell apologise to the mother of his child after "abusing her for nine months". 
It comes as the Irish hunk followed Stephanie Davis on Twitter, prompting speculation the pair could be heading for a reconciliation - or at the very least a drama-free friendship. 
The move came hours after the Irish model finally acknowledged that he IS the father of Steph's baby. 
Jeremy - who has denied paternity since Stephanie announced she was pregnant - shared an image of baby Caben-Albi George Davis for the first time. Jeremy McConnell (Photo: Rex Features) (Photo: Twitter/@Stephdavis77) Stephanie Davis with her brother Jordan (Photo: Instagram/stephaniedavis88) 
And fans reacted viciously, calling on the vest-loving lothario to apologise to his long suffering baby mama after repeatedly claiming that Caben wasn't his child and slamming Steph during her pregnancy. 
One wrote: "Looks like you are the daddy then! Jeremy think you should do some serious apologising." Another added: "Let's hope you're going to prove that love to your son! Anyone can write it in a tweet!" 
Last night Jez posted an adorable picture of his son alongside the message: "Happiest man alive, my new focus". Stephanie Davis (Photo: WENN.COM) 
He also recently admitted that if he is the dad, he will be prepared to work together with Steph for the sake of their son. 
The tattooed hunk met the former Hollyoaks actress last year when they both took part in Celebrity Big Brother . 
They fell in love and continued dating on the outside world until things turned sour a few months later. Read More Stephanie Davis and Jeremy McConnell (Photo: Supplied by WENN) Stephanie Davis and Jeremy McConnell met in CBB last year (Photo: Stephanie Davis / Twitter) 
Steph soon found out she was pregnant and at the time, Jeremy said it wasn't true. 
He then denied the baby was his when it became obvious she was expecting, and said he wanted a paternity test. 
Jeremy was seen on This Morning earlier this week having a DNA sample taken, but it is unknown if the test was carried out or what the results were. 
However, it seems like Jeremy is making it clear that he is the father and that little Caben will be part of his life. Jeremy shared this picture of Caben-Albi 
It comes after Stephanie Davis deleted any trace of the statement she put out after her ex, Jeremy McConnell, took swabs for a DNA test on live TV. 
Following the This Morning segment on Thursday, during which Jeremy opened up about not being there for Steph throughout her pregnancy, the ex-Hollyoaks star had tweeted a statement about Jez's treatment of her. 
She said she felt "humiliated" by the way in which Jeremy demanded to know whether he was the father of her newborn baby, Caben-Albi, and said he had ruined her pregnancy. Read More
